posts._title: Sabrina Zhao – The Good Woman of Sichuan (2021)
posts.title: The Good Woman of Sichuan
posts.excerpt: We don’t see the woman on the train moving through Sichuan, just the trees, rivers, lakes and houses passing by the window, vanishing behind the blur of vegetation, segmented by the tunnels.

SYNOPSISEarly evening – a big city. Two teenagers shyly flirt with each other, a housewife sits down to watch her daily soap, nurses in a hospital gossip before the nightshift starts, a trendy couple drives through rush hour, so excited they can hardly wait to get home – a man with a rifle enters a …

posts.title: Printtemps

posts._title: Steven Arnold – The Liberation of Mannique Mechanique (1967)
posts.title: The Liberation of Mannique Mechanique
posts.excerpt: Quote:Loosely based on William A. Seiter’s 1948 film One Touch of Venus, Steven Arnold’s first film is a macabre, decadent work presenting mannequins and models that travel through strange universes. From Amos Vogel’s Film as a Subversive Art:A haunting, genuinely decadent work about mannequins that may be real and girls that may be models, journeying …

posts.title: Heliografía (remix)
posts.excerpt: SynopsisDigital edition of the original 1993 video-tape. Dedicated to Dr. Albert Hofmann and his famous bicycle trip.(FILMAFFINITY)

posts.title: Lemongrass Girl
posts.excerpt: The young Piano gets lumbered with the job of keeping the set dry during the shoot for Anocha Suwichakornpong’s latest film Come Here. Only she seems capable of warding off the rain.

posts.title: Working Girls
posts.excerpt: Sex. Money. Kinky Customers. Lunch. For These Girls, It’s All In A Day’s Work. A day in the life of several sex workers in an upscale Manhattan brothel. The film is a stark portrayal of the women, the male customers and the motivations of both. Watch as the madam manipulates her “girls”. Watch as she …

posts.title: The Man Who Knew 75 Languages

posts._title: Kurt Maetzig – Das Kaninchen bin ich AKA The Rabbit is Me [+Extras] (1965)
posts.title: Das Kaninchen bin ich
posts.excerpt: This East German film about corruption in high places, and self-serving party officials, and abuse of power, was withheld from release from its completion in 1965 until 1990, shortly before the Berlin wall went down and the reunification process began. posts._title: Rudolf Thome – Das rote Zimmer AKA The Red Room (2010)
posts.title: Das rote Zimmer
posts.excerpt: At the Institute of Biochemistry in Berlin, the kiss researcher Fred Hintermeier is investigating what happens in the human organism during kissing. But he isn’t married, or in a relationship. His wife has recently divorced him. He is magically attracted by the gleaming colours of a tray in an antique store window. He buys it …
